newsitem.title: GERMANY: Airlines switch to belly cargo from freighters.
newsitem.headline: Airlines switch to belly cargo from freighters.

text.p: Airlines are cutting back on freighter operations at Frankfurt airport in favour of transporting freight as belly cargo, Flughafen Frankfurt Main AG (FAG) said.
Belly cargo grew at 6.4 percent in October compared to a 2.8 percent rise in freighter cargo, the latest monthly FAG traffic report showed.
In contrast, freighter cargo has grown 4.9 percent and belly cargo only 1.1 percent over the first ten months of the year, it said.
"As a result of existing over-capacities in freight transportation and the increasing pressure for rationalisation, some services with all-cargo aircraft have been discontinued," the report said.
"Thus cargo carried in the holds of passenger aircraft showed accelerated growth while tonnage growth in freighter services was only modest," it added.
The report gave no details of which freighter services have been dropped.

Frankfurt airport registered a record single day's cargo volume on one Saturday in October when just under 4,900 tonnes of cargo was handled, the report said. -- Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
